intro: Solanum juninense, commonly known as the Junín nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Solanum juninense is also known for its potential medicinal properties and has been studied for its bioactive compounds.
